title: Man City's injury crisis deepens after double blow before Aston Villa clash
text:

Pep Guardiola’s injury problems have deepened after Oleksandr Zinchenko was ruled out for up to six weeks with a knee injury.

Zinchenko has had surgery in Barcelona to clean out his knee and Guardiola says the Ukrainian will be out until the start of December.

Guardiola also revealed that Rodri will be out until after the international break with the hamstring injury he suffered against Atalanta on Tuesday.

The pair will miss the huge clash with Liverpool in just over two weeks’ time in addition to long-term casualty Aymeric Laporte.

On Zinchenko, Guardiola said: “He has had a contact with his knee and felt something on the bone.

(Image: zinchenko_96/Instagram)

(Image: Getty Images)

“He’s had to stop for four to five weeks. He’s had some surgery to clean up the knee.

“It’s not a big issue, but he’ll be out for five to six weeks.”

Rodri will be out for at least four weeks and Guardiola said: “They tell me it will be until after the international break that he will be ready again.”

Guardiola will face his former midfielder Douglas Luiz tomorrow when Aston Villa visit the Etihad and he says he might have been lining up for them if he had been granted a work permit.

(Image: AFP via Getty Images)

Luiz, 21, was on loan at City’s sister club Girona in Spain before the Brazilian was sold to Villa for £15million in July.

“He would be here if it had been possible, if the Premier League had said it would be possible,” said the City boss.

“We have an option to get him back, but sometimes life is like this.

“Last season we had a problem and didn’t buy a holding midfielder. We thought about it, but the work permit meant it was not possible.

“I think he had the quality to play with us but he could not do it.”
description: Oleksandr Zinchenko has been ruled out for up to six weeks while Rodri is out for at least four weeks
